DadÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s Army was a British sitcom about the Home Guard in the Second World War. It 
was written by Jimmy Perry and David Croft and broadcast on BBC television 
between 1968 and 1977. The series ran for 9 series and 80 episodes in total, 
plus a radio series, a feature film and a stage show. The series regularly 
gained audiences of 18 million viewers and is still repeated today on BBC Two.

SERIES ONE AND SERIES TWO WERE FILMED IN BLACK AND WHITE, HENCE ARE RELEASED THIS WAY,

EPISODE 6 IS IN BLACK AND WHITE, BECAUSE IT HAS NOT YET BEEN RE-COLOURED BY THE BBC!
